name: EEC INVESTS IN CANYON OUTPOST
text:
EEC INVESTS IN CANYON OUTPOST

A western company notorious for its trade monopoly in Morrowind (for better or for worse), the East Empire Company has announced a new investment venture: a caravanserai trading post for merchants travelling along the Purple Road between Narsis and Nibenay.

Contracted exclusively with the Fighters Guild for protection, the "St. Ino's Caravanserai" is based out of a former small ranch belonging to a proud Dunmeri family -- what does this mean for the future of independent Dunmer trade with foreign merchants, when the Empire controls trade on both sides of the border? The EEC's refusal to contract a local Dunmer Tong or the proud Shinathi people of Shipal Shin, as well as the erasure of traditional familial agriculture can only mean one thing: the Empire's ruthless expansion both territoriality and monetarily will not stop, and it falls to hard working, dignified citizens of Morrowind to resolve this injustice.

While this may aid Narsis' economy in the short term -- EEC stocks rising at the Mesa Exchange as outlander excitement gets ahead of itself -- it is sure to poison the future prospects of the city and House Hlaalu should nothing be done to prevent these overzealous, expansionist western corporations.
